page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: {Pottery industry} developed in 18th century; no potteries survive today but many traces of clay pits. Village often known as "Black Burton". Bridge End ( Bradshaw's ) Pottery is now 3 cottages, Waterside ( Bateson's ) Potteryis a row of 4 cottages, a house & a ruin. Nearby, traces of old osier beds & clay pans remain. A single cottage survives from the Parker / Bateson Barnawick Pottery. Sherds of pottery waste are found in the river. Town End Pottery is now a Council yard. Joiner's Arms was once Potter's Arms (Slate beds of water tanks still to be seen). Richard Timperley Bateson aged 93, last of Burton's potters, closed Waterside Pottery in 1944.
